intro: Lentiscus kakrasinghee, commonly known as the Indian mastic tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Oleaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. It is often found in dry, rocky areas and is valued for its aromatic resins and medicinal properties. Lentiscus kakrasinghee is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing benefits.
